title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a news quiz to test knowledge of Greater Boston's latest stories.
Peter Chianca, Boston.com's editor since 2019, oversees the news quiz section.
The quiz features trending topics in the Greater Boston area, such as Halloween events and local incidents.

title: Marco Sturm’s faith in Marat Khusnutdinov gets rewarded with Bruins OT winner
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marat Khusnutdinov scores overtime goal, securing Bruins' 4-3 win against Buffalo Sabres.
Coach Marco Sturm promoted Khusnutdinov to top line, showing faith in his potential despite limited initial play.
Despite Elias Lindholm's injury, Khusnutdinov shifted to center, contributing to the team's success at faceoffs.

title: Why Dan Orlovsky believes Drake Maye is NFL MVP frontrunner
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Dan Orlovsky considers Drake Maye the current NFL MVP leader despite Jonathan Taylor's strong performance.
Drake Maye's stats include a 75.2% completion rate with 15 TDs and 3 interceptions for the 6-2 Patriots.
In DraftKings MVP odds, Drake Maye is ranked third, behind Patrick Mahomes and Josh Allen.

title: Brookline farm starts free farmers market as Mass. residents brace for SNAP shutdown
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Allandale Farm has partnered with Loring Greenough House to provide a free farmers market in Jamaica Plain.
The market, open Thursdays in November, addresses food insecurity from the government shutdown affecting SNAP benefits.
Governor Maura Healey announced a new SNAP resource hub and increased support for food banks in response to the shutdown.

title: $9,000 in donations stolen from Catholic church in Watertown, police say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: An estimated $9,000 in donations was stolen from St. Patrick's Church in Watertown on October 27, 2025.
The theft occurred after 5:30 p.m. and was reported to police the following morning at 8:30 a.m.
Watertown police have no suspects and urge anyone with information to contact Detective Joe Kelland at 617-600-1310.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm exits game with lower-body injury
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm of the Boston Bruins exited with a lower-body injury after a collision against the Sabres.
Lindholm has been a key performer with four power-play goals in 12 games this season for the Bruins.
Marat Khusnutdinov scored the overtime winner after taking Lindholm's center position in the Bruins' 4-3 win.

title: David Ortiz offers up advice to Mookie Betts amid World Series slump
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mookie Betts is in a slump, hitting .130 with no RBIs in the World Series against the Blue Jays.
David Ortiz advised Betts to have fun and let go of past performances during the World Series coverage on FOX.
The Dodgers' key hitters, including Betts, struggled in Game 5, contributing to a 3-2 series deficit against Toronto.

title: Irish firefighter found guilty of raping woman in Boston hotel, sentenced to 7-9 years in prison
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Irish firefighter Terence Crosbie found guilty of rape in Boston hotel, sentenced to 7-9 years in state prison.
Crosbie's second trial followed a mistrial; he was visiting Boston for St. Patrick's Day parade when the incident occurred.
Prosecutors cited video, DNA, and key card evidence; Crosbie plans to appeal, claiming a miscarriage of justice.

title: Brockton man allegedly in US illegally sentenced to prison for raping 14-year-old girl
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Brockton's Erickson Barbosa, 32, sentenced to seven years for raping a 14-year-old girl in 2020.
Barbosa first contacted the victim in a Taunton park, later raping her twice in his vehicle.
Barbosa, a Cape Verdean citizen, may face deportation after serving his sentence for rape charges.

title: ‘Special stuff’: Why Patriots CB Marcus Jones’s October was one to remember
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Marcus Jones signs a three-year contract extension with New England Patriots and is named AFC Defensive Player of the Month.
Jones excels as a defensive back, contributing to key plays including an interception against Josh Allen and ranking high in tackles.
In the return game, Jones is third in the NFL for punt return yards with noteworthy performances, like an 87-yard touchdown against the Panthers.
